author: mini_mads1980
title: Your Pizza Is Moments Away!
review:
Overview

Following last months visit to space we are back down to earth and feeling hungry, so Issue 19 of the Lego City Comic gives you Ben Ryder on his pizza delivery bike.  This particular issue was on sale from 25th September 2019 and 22nd October 2019.

Packet

The larger foil pack shows Ben riding his bike to deliver a few boxes of pizza.  He is holding one in the air, which is not being carried flat so there may be an unhappy customer later!  The packet suggests you need to be over 6 for this, but younger kids would be fine with the build - supervised of course.

On the back it has the 1x1 image of the 2x2 pizza box tile.

Minifigure

Ben Ryder is unique to this set, his head has been used in 15 sets including four of the People Packs, his torso is also common and has appeared in 11 sets since 2016.  His legs are plain Earth Blue and he has a black crash helmet.

In the comic you see Ben without his helmet sporting a mohican hair style, but you don't get the hair element to match.

Main Build/Parts

The build is complete in four steps as it is only a motorcycle, which you could probably build in a matter of seconds.  The pizza boxes, one printed and two 2x2 jumper plates, simply stick to the back of the bike - so doubtful that they would still be there once Ben reaches the customer.

The bike is basically the same as the one that appears in 60214: Burger Bar Fire Rescue, 60216: Downtown Fire Brigade and a couple of Batman sets.

Verdict

For me the motorbike is completely the wrong type for a pizza delivery bike.  A bike like the scooter in 60150: Pizza Van (part 15396) would have been much better, especially in a new colour like white or blue.  Ignoring the pizza element you get a nice bike that is not for fire rescue with a good Minifigure that would compliment most Lego cities.

This comic cost £4.25, so a reduction from last month but only one set so very reasonable in my view.  Inclusion of a hair element would have helped.

Next month is a female police officer with a speed trap, so Ben had better make sure that he delivers his pizza's while obeying the speed limit of Lego City.
